crown-navy.name: The Crown Navy
crown-navy.description: The Crown’s naval arm seeking to restore “law” and tax the sea lanes via patrols, warrants, and informants.
crown-navy.history: A plainclothes lieutenant asked after Ben the Muster’s berth at Sablemarket Cay.

eastwater-company.name: Eastwater Company
eastwater-company.description: A trade power aiming to monopolize commerce, insurance, and salvage rights using coin, contracts, and mercenaries.
eastwater-company.history: Pressuring crews with exclusive work; Factor Lysa Quell offers an “exclusive” week through a courier.

free-harbors-league.name: Free Harbors League
free-harbors-league.description: A coalition that keeps pirate havens independent—so long as dues, votes, or blood uphold the League’s terms.
free-harbors-league.history: One of the three major powers shaping the archipelago’s politics and sanctuary ports.

blackwake-circle.name: Rival Captains (the Blackwake Circle)
blackwake-circle.description: A loose fraternity of notorious captains who feud, ally, and sometimes vote to name a common enemy.
blackwake-circle.history: Includes Captain Joryn “Gullknife” Sable, active at Sablemarket Cay during the rumor-auction.

tideborn-covenant.name: The Tideborn Covenant
tideborn-covenant.description: Sea-mystics who trade blessings and concealment for secrets, names, and binding vows to “keep the deep asleep.”
tideborn-covenant.history: Their oath-and-price witchcraft is a known force in the archipelago’s power struggles.
